instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_LCD: What is PP3V3_S5_LCD? PP3V3_S5_LCD is a power rail that eventually powers circuitry in the LCD after going through something else. This is required for the LCD to turn on and have a nimage. .
definitions.LVDS_DDC_CLK: What is LVDS_DDC_CLK? LVDS_DDC_CLK Is the DDC clock line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
Board had corrosion in multiple parts, but nothing major.

Already tried reballing and replacing SMC

The weird problem is that there is USB activity with the display connected (tried 2 different ones) when I connect the display the USB thumb drive instead of getting activity it turns off then it tries again but it also turns off for a second or two, when this happens <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> pulses to 0 then back again, this doesn't happen with LCD disconnected.

With LCD connected Pin 2 of J9000 is 0V, <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> Pin 3 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_LCD</SIGNAL> is 3.3V but Pin 1 <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
Please specify, missing internal and external image?
No internal image at all, w/ or w/o external monitor connected?

External monitor is driven through Thunderbolt.
Do you get correct Thunderbolt voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
Sorry, missing internal image only, external OK and when there is external image there is no internal image either.

I can see something trying to show up on screen but there is no backlight so it is hard to see what is showing up, but whatever it is it is not a clear image or anything normal.

Since I do have external image do you still need Thunderbolt voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
Thunderbolt is OK, if you get external video; wasn't clear from your first post.

You can't get internal image without <SIGNAL>3V3_LCDVDD</SIGNAL>; for this reason no backlight also.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at pins 4, 6, 7 of J9000.
Check L9008 and <RESISTOR>R9008</RESISTOR>/9.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
L9080 is OK and its diode reading on both lines are ok too.
<RESISTOR>R9008</RESISTOR>/9 both OK

J9000
4 0.341 3.3V
6 0.590 3.3V
7 0.570 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
Test with known good LCD assembly.
Be sure LCD connector has good solders, traces and internal terminals

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message: Tried 2 known good LCD with board alone, LCD connector looks clean inside and out, solders look perfect, not sure what else to check.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird no image issue
threads.message:
PCH talks with LCD through <SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_CLK</SIGNAL>/DATA lines, before enabling <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>.
You should check with o-scope if communication exists.
